original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on fears of potential debt restructuring after the island secured the International Monetary Fund agreement, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index (ASPI) edged down 0.94 percent or 88.74 points to 9,330.61, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 1.19 percent or 32.36 points to 2,693.16.

“There is a downward sentiment in the market, after the IMF approval as investors aren’t sure of debt restructuring processes and are holding back investing in the bank and financial sector,” an analyst said.
Top losers during 113o hours were Vallibel Finance, Sampath Bank and Hatton National Bank.
“The indexes are coming down in value because of fears of debt restructuring,” an analyst said.

The market is generating revenue from Sri Lanka Telecom over news of it being divested, moreover there has been interests for the hotel and tourism indexes, since tourist arrivals and earnings have been favorable, an analyst said. (Colombo/
